harmonious 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Randomly Sample a Cholesky Factorized, Lower Triangular Matrix from a Lewandowski-Kurowicka-Joe Distribution

    rCorr.Rd

    Generates a lower triangular, invertible, positive-definite matrix

    rCorr(nDim, eta = 1)

    Arguments

    nDim

    desired dimension of the sampled \(n \times n\) matrix

    eta

    concentration hyperparameter

    Value

    a lower triangular \(n \times n\) matrix

    Details

    Using the onion method (Ghosh & Henderson, 2003), samples a Cholesky factorized lower-triangular matrix \(L\) from a Lewandowski-Kurowicka-Joe (LKJ) distribution given the concentration hyperparameter \(\eta\), such that: \[A=LL^{\top}\] where \(A\) is a \(n \times n\) matrix and is a member of the set of all symmetric, positive-definite matrices.

    References

    Ghosh, S. and Henderson, S. G. (2003). Behavior of the norta method for correlated random vector generation as the dimension increases. ACM Transactions on Modeling and Computer Simulation, 13(3), 276-294. https://doi.org/10.1145/937332.937336
